_exec_summary.SummaryText:
TCEQ Facility ID NUMBER: Air New Source Permit 79180

RMP Executive Summary

Accidental Release Prevention and Release Policies

 
Gas Innovations has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety and environmental protection.  It is the company?s policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident and environmental pollution prevention, such as training personnel, and considering those factors in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of our processes.  Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of substances.  However, if a release does occur, trained personnel will respond to control and contain the accidental release.  This facility complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) Standard 58 requirements for liquefied petroleum gas storage.
 

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

Gas Innovations is an independent wholesale provider of gases to industrial gas and welding distributors.  Their facility located in Harris County, Texas, also provides other services such as ultrasonic testing for cylinder re-certification and re-qualification, hydrotesting, cylinder restoration (blast and paint), cylinder decommission, visual inspection and certification, internal wash and clean, and de- and re-valve, among others.  Gas Innovations was evaluated to determine if any regulated flammable or toxic substances, as defined under section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act, was used, stored, manufactured, or handled in any process on site in exceedance of the threshold quantity established on 40 CFR Part 68, Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions.  Based on process knowledge, Gas Innovations identified seven (7) regulated substances that are stored on site and used in the process in quantities that exceeded the threshold value.

The regulated substances that are handled at this site in exceedance of t

he threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds are Isobutylene, Butene, Isobutane, Propane, Propylene, and Butane.  Gas Innovations also handles Hydrogen Chloride in exceedance of its threshold quantity of 5,000 pounds.  These gases are distributed to clients in bulk or cylinders.  These regulated substances are stored at the site in bulk process storage tanks.  These tanks are filled between 85% and 88% of their capacity.  The expected quantities stored and used at the site of these regulated substances vary from 17,000 pounds to 62,000 pounds.  

 
Accidental Release Prevention Program

Gas Innovations has implemented an emergency response program that includes incident prevention and investigation.  The bulk storage tanks are equipped with release prevention devices that include emergency shut-off, manual valves, purge flow valves, relief valves, high pressure regulators and back check valves.  The equipment is included in a prevention maintenance program as recommended by the equipment manufacturers.

Gas Innovations is subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) rules.  The site has performed process hazards review to the regulated processes under the Risk Management Program (RMP), which includes the flammable gases and the hydrogen chloride storage and handling processes.

Five Year Accident History

In the past five years Gas Innovations has had no accidental releases of the regulated substances that have caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

Emergency Response Program

The facility has an Emergency Response (ER) program which has been coordinated with the community.  The facility?s ER program includes specific actions to be taken in response to accidental releases of the regulated substances.  The facility?s ER program includes procedures for informing the public and local agencies responding to accidental release at the site.  The facility?s ER program

includes information on emergency health care.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There is no need to identify plans to improve safety at the current time.  Gas Innovations understands that the facility has in place all required procedures to comply with applicable regulations to protect both the health and safety of its employees and surrounding community and the environment.  Periodic safety and pollution prevention reviews are performed to processes, procedures and the facility, in general, to assure the site complies with all applicable regulations in the prevention of accidental releases that can affect the safety and health of its employees and its surrounding community and the environment.
